XIII.i.3.H.1.d
.
Entitlement to CHAMPVA for Surviving Spouses That Remarry After Age 55
The Veterans Benefits Act of 2002,
PL 107-330
, which went into effect February 4, 2003, provides for the retention of CHAMPVA eligibility for surviving spouses who remarry after age 55.  For those individuals who remarried after age 55 but prior to the effective date of this law, eligibility may be established only if an application was received between February 5, 2002, and February 4, 2003.
title: M21-1, Part XIII, Subpart i, Chapter 3, Section H - Civilian Health and Medical Program of the Department of Veterans Affairs (CHAMPVA) Eligibility Determinations
